alert.note: Alert for Tarrant (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 17 at 9:41PM CDT until further notice by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following counties, Dallas and Tarrant. * WHEN...Until 100 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible. - Locations that will experience flooding include... Dallas, Fort Worth, Arlington, and surrounding areas.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
